newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks ease on technical correction.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks ease on technical correction.

text.p: Pakistani stocks eased on Friday mainly on a technical correction ahead of the Saturday-Sunday weekend as investors kept to the sidelines because of political and economic uncertainty, dealers said.

"On the political front, the PML (Pakistan Muslim League) has yet to settle some differences with its allies, specially in the Sindh province," dealer Zubair Ilahi said adding that country's economic outlook also appears grim.
The index fell 7.80 points, or 0.49 percent, to 1,580.25 an hour before the end. Losers led gainers 213 to 48. Dewan Salman Fibre fell 0.10 rupees to 40.70. -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192
